description:
Ichigo Kurosaki has always been able to see ghosts, but this ability doesn't change his life nearly as much as his close encounter with Rukia Kuchiki, a Soul Reaper and member of the mysterious Soul Society. While fighting a Hollow, an evil spirit that preys on humans who display psychic energy, Rukia attempts to lend Ichigo some of her powers so that he can save his family; but much to her surprise, Ichigo absorbs every last drop of her energy. Now a full-fledged Soul Reaper himself, Ichigo quickly learns that the world he inhabits is one full of dangerous spirits and, along with Rukia— who is slowly regaining her powers— it's Ichigo's job to protect the innocent from Hollows and help the spirits themselves find peace.

(Source: Viz Media)

Note: Chapter count includes the 12-chapter “Turn Back The Pendulum” side story and 8 extra chapters.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

node.description: Ricardo Cruz is a Brazilian-born Japanese vocalist known for singing anime theme songs in Brazil as well as collaborating with animesong supergroup JAM Project on their singles "GONG", "STORMBRINGER", and most recently "Shugojin-The guardian". He also wrote the Japanese lyrics for the bonus track "NEO" off of Aquaria's album Shambala and for "Sempre sonhando" ("Always dreaming"), a song from the JAM Project album "Get over the border". As a "part-time" member of JAM Project, he tours with the group in Latin America, acting as a translator.

[Blog](https://dashofgreen.blogspot.com/)

She is an American freelance translator. She and her husband, letterer [James Dashiell](https://anilist.co/staff/225315/James-Dashiell) work as a team for lettering and translating manga.

Mark McMurray is a seasoned freelance artist with extensive experience in digital lettering and art retouching for notable manga publications at [VIZ Media](https://anilist.co/studio/119/Viz-Media) since February 2004.

Mark McMurray is a seasoned freelance artist with extensive experience in digital lettering and art retouching for notable manga publications at [VIZ Media](https://anilist.co/studio/119/Viz-Media) since February 2004.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marcbernabe) |  [Official Website](https://www.japonesenvinetas.com)

He is a translator and interpreter of Japanese, with special emphasis on the translation of manga and anime, a field in which he has a background of hundreds of volumes and episodes translated. In addition, he's a  specialist in didactics of the Japanese language and culture for Spanish speakers. He also has published many books about Japan and Asia.

He is famous for appearing in a Shin-chan's episode where the family goes to Spain.

She was an assistant of [Tite Kubo](https://anilist.co/staff/96880/Tite-Kubo) and [Akira Amano](https://anilist.co/staff/96907/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimoto1222)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pawel_dybala)
Besides translation, he also does lectures and research at the Jagiellonian University in Kraków. Works with publishers J.P.Fantastica and Egmont Poland.

A Swedish translator who was active in the manga field starting in the '00s, through the collapse of the Swedish manga industry at the end of the decade. Initially, he ran the now-defunct translation contracting company Sajco with Janne Lund, with whom he was hired to translate Yu-Gi-Oh for Bonnier Carlsen – but later worked alone on a variety of other titles, many of which ran in the Swedish edition of Shonen Jump.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/verocalafell) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/vero.calafell)

She is a translator and interpreter, specialising in literary and audiovisual translation from Japanese and English into Spanish and Catalan. She has a degree in Translation and Interpretation from the Autonomous University of Barcelona and a Master in International Relations from the University of Osaka. She has also studied at the Kyoto University of Foreign Studies.

Asada Takanori is a magazine editor. In 1995, he joined Shueisha and began working at the editorial department of Weekly Shounen Jump. In 2014, he became the editor-in-chief of Shueisha's light novel label JUMP j-BOOKS.
